messages.title: UKIP: Ready to win here
messages.content: UKIP beat Labour and the Lib Dems across the whole country - proving that UKIP are no longer a minor party.

messages.title: Stop paying the EU £40 million a day.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Control our borders / Skilled migration, not mass immigration.

mentions.tacticalSituation: UKIP beat Labour and the Lib Dems across the whole country - proving that UKIP are no longer a minor party.

issues.brexitEurope: Stop paying the EU £40 million a day.
issues.immigration: Control our borders / Skilled migration, not mass immigration.

housing.content: Free parking at Ipswich hospital as it is wrong to make money out of people who are ill or visiting friends / family visiting. The charge is only profit for the car parking firm.

leaflet.personalStatement: My local policies are to reopen Broomhill swimming pool, support a unitary authority for Ipswich to stop duplication of services, and introduce free parking at Ipswich hospital as it is wrong to make money out of people who are ill or visiting friends / family visiting. The charge is only profit for the car parking firm.

contactInformation.address: 99 Foxglove Avenue, Needham Market, Ipswich, Suffolk, IP6 8JJ

quotes.text: In June we made history by finishing second nationally at the European elections. We have an excellent local candidate for the General Election - who will be asking for your support not just on the European Union, but also on issues like lower tax, freedom from crime and a firm but fair immigration policy.
quotes.source: Nigel Farage MEP, UK Independence Party.

images.caption: Graph showing UKIP's position in the National poll results from the European elections, June 2009.
Image of UKIP candidate Chris Streatfield.
Image indicative of a policy of no tax on minimum wage.
Image indicative of a policy of zero tolerance on crime.
Image indicative of controlling borders and skilled migration.
